captions.text: Welcome to a new video!
In this tutorial I will show you
how to speed up breaking in synthetic football boots
like the Magista or Superfly.
This way you can stay clear of getting blisters.
Enjoy the video!
As I already mentioned in the review
the backheel of the Magista is pretty hard.
By dipping the boot into hot water
I want to speed up breaking in the boots.
I take out the sole before putting the boot into the water.
Really dip the back of the boots underwater.
I would recommend warm or hot water from the tap.
If you have dents or blisters on your skin
you can also use boiling water in exceptional cases.
Leave the boots underwater for about ten minutes.
Move and stretch the boots from time to time.
I had massive problems with the backheel of the boot.
I suffered large blisters.
After ten minutes, remove the boots from the water.
Important: Do not blow them dry!
Let them dry naturally.
This method is suitable for synthetic boots only!
Do not use this tutorial for leather boots!
They will be damaged!

title: Cristiano Ronaldo Hot Water Trick (Superfly IV & Magista)

comments.text:
Matthew: Hi, my name is Matthew. How may I help you?
Rene Flores: hey i have a question about the superfly 4's. ive heard that 
they give big blisters on the back of the foot due to the heel counter and 
back part
Matthew: Havent really had complaints on the superflys
Rene Flores: i saw a video about the hot water trick from freekickerz and 
they said that you guys approved of using the hot water trick as long as 
you don't blow dry them
Rene Flores:  Cristiano Ronaldo Hot Water Trick (Superfly IV & Magista)
Matthew: Let me take a look since I've never heard of that.
Rene Flores: ok
Rene Flores: on the video you need to turn on captions on the bottom
Matthew: Thank you for that because I truly got confused
Rene Flores: no problem
Matthew: That is the first time hearing something like that. The only thing 
we hear about them that people dont like are the shoe laces seem to break 
majority of the time but blisters never got a complaint about that.
Rene Flores: oh ok but if i do feel there is a problem would you think that 
would do any damage
Rene Flores: because your not heating the sole plate just the back part
Rene Flores: i talked with Nike about this Hot Water Trick - they said, as 
long you dont use a air dryer, everything is fine - the boots wont crack 
because of the hot water..﻿

Matthew: No it wouldn't but smart to air dry like the video suggested. 
Rene Flores: that is what he said
Matthew: Yeah because a dryer will mess the whole cleat up.
Rene Flores: ok but it would be ok to do it and naturally dry them? 
Matthew: Yeah. ﻿
